security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only instructional markdown content. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access, environment variable reads, or external command execution capabilities. The content provides structured guidance for design discussions.

content.user_title: Refine ideas into detailed designs through structured dialogue
content.value_statement: Vague requirements lead to costly rework and missed deadlines. This skill transforms rough ideas into validated designs through Socratic dialogue, ensuring clarity before implementation begins.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through understanding their own requirements via sequential questions
Present multiple solution approaches with pros, cons, and trade-offs
Break complex designs into digestible 200-300 word sections
Validate designs incrementally before committing to implementation
Produce standardized design document output with key sections
Apply YAGNI principles to eliminate speculative features
limitations: Does not execute code or access external systems
Requires active user participation through sequential questions
Cannot access project files without explicit user request
Design quality depends on user provided context and answers

use_cases.title: Clarify feature requirements
use_cases.description: Transform stakeholder requests into clear, implementable feature specifications before development begins

use_cases.title: Explore solution options
use_cases.description: Evaluate multiple architectural approaches with trade-off analysis before committing to a design

use_cases.title: Refine vague ideas
use_cases.description: Convert abstract feature ideas into concrete component designs, data flows, and error handling strategies

prompt_templates.title: New Feature Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me design a [feature type] for [project type]. First, I need to understand the goal. What problem are we solving and who is the primary user?

prompt_templates.title: Architecture Options
prompt_templates.prompt: Present 2-3 different architectural approaches for [feature]. For each, explain the approach, pros, cons, and when it works best.

prompt_templates.title: Data Flow Design
prompt_templates.prompt: Now let's break down the data flow for our design. What are the key components and how does data move between them?

prompt_templates.title: Complete Design Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my draft design document. Check for missing components, unclear error handling, or speculative features that should be deferred per YAGNI principles.

output_examples.input: Help me design a user notification system
output: Goal: Deliver timely, relevant alerts to users across multiple channels (email, push, in-app)
Key components identified: Notification Service, Template Engine, Delivery Queue, Preference Manager, Analytics Tracker
Recommended approach: Event-driven architecture with message queue for reliability and scalability
Data flow: Trigger â†’ Enrich â†’ Template â†’ Queue â†’ Delivery â†’ Track â†’ Archive
Open questions: Should we support notification batching? What is the retry strategy for failed deliveries?

best_practices: Ask one question at a time and wait for answers before proceeding to the next
Present approaches conversationally, not prescriptively, remaining open to hybrid solutions
Validate each design section incrementally before moving to the next section
Eliminate speculative features using YAGNI principles
anti_patterns: Asking multiple questions simultaneously which overwhelms users
Jumping to the first solution without exploring alternatives
Designing features that are not required for the MVP
Committing to implementation before requirements are validated

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Works with any AI assistant that follows structured dialogue approaches.

faq.question: How long does a typical brainstorming session take?
faq.answer: Simple features take 15-30 minutes. Complex systems may require multiple sessions to fully explore requirements and options.

faq.question: Can I use this skill for non-software ideas?
faq.answer: Yes. The structured dialogue approach works for any domain including business processes, content strategies, or organizational design.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: This skill is read-only. It only guides discussion. It does not access, store, or transmit any project data without explicit user requests.

faq.question: What if I do not know the answers to questions?
faq.answer: That is expected. The skill helps identify gaps. If answers are unknown, the skill suggests how to gather that information before proceeding.

faq.question: How is this different from generic prompting?
faq.answer: This skill follows research-backed techniques including Verbalized Sampling, Socratic dialogue, and iterative validation for higher quality outcomes.
